definition: closely/tightly
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: The man always holds woman's hand closely to grasp.
sentences.chinese: 男亽始终抓住女亽旳掱紧紧握著。

sentences.english: He enfolded his lover in his arms.
Many cars lay jostling each other at the parking lot.
sentences.chinese: 许多汽车在停车场上紧紧挨在一起。

sentences.english: The skin of her cheeks tautened.
sentences.chinese: 她双颊的皮肤绷得紧紧的。

sentences.english: She gripped the bars tightly during her acrobatic routine.
sentences.chinese: 她做规定动作时紧紧抓住了双杠。

sentences.english: Fixing the boy with a steady look,the teacher forced him to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 老师的目光紧紧盯着学生，迫使他说出了真情。

sentences.english: He clung to the rope with both hands.
The door held fast, obviously locked.
sentences.chinese: 门关得紧紧的，显然锁上了。

sentences.english: The town's mayor, Jin Sato, spent the night on the roof clutching to a fence on its edge. (AP Photo/David Guttenfelder)
sentences.chinese: 市长佐藤金整个晚上都在紧紧抓住一个围栏的边缘。

sentences.english: I felt his eyes narrowly upon me.
sentences.chinese: 我感到他的眼睛在紧紧地盯着我。

sentences.english: Parents' love, like air tightly to my parcel.
sentences.chinese: 父母爱，似空气紧紧将我包裹。

sentences.english: Through the system of lakes and rivers, Chicago was well connected to all of the American states.
sentences.chinese: 透过河湖系统，芝加哥与美国各州紧紧联系。

sentences.english: She huddles against the seat. Clamps her hand over her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 她缩回到座位上，用手紧紧地捂住自己的嘴。

sentences.english: Then she gave a deep sight and snuggled into my arms.
sentences.chinese: 接着她深深叹口气，紧紧的偎依在我的怀抱里。

sentences.english: Fasten toward the deep place of heart tightly.
Would you stand by me, let me hold you tight.
sentences.chinese: 你会不会静立在旁，让我紧紧抱住你。

definition: rigid/unwavering/unbendable/firm (hold on sth)/tenacious
tightfisted/stingy/short of money/hard up
to hug/to embrace
to grip/to hold
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten
to hold in one's arms/to embrace
to hug/to embrace/to hold in one's arms
to draw towards oneself/to gather/to gather up (one's gown, sleeves etc)/to grab (money)/to extort
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to hold/to grip/to grasp
embrace/bosom
firmly/safely
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
arms/both arms/two arms
to stretch out
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
to hold firmly, not let go
